text: A high angle looking out over a well-manicured baseball f carved out of a tropical jungle. A game is currently in progress.

Wearing KANSAS CITY KNIGHTS uniforms, mostly Black and da skinned Dominicans as well as several lighter-skinned Venezuelans (17-22 years old) are set in their positions, for the next pitch. CLOSE ON the pitcher, MIGUEL SANTOS (aka AZUCAR/SUGAR - 1 lean, Black and handsome). Sweat drips down his face in t oppressive midday heat. He steadies his glove and ball at chest, peeking over at the RUNNER on first base. Miguel l his leg high into the air, rears back his right arm, and the ball toward the plate. THUD! A cloud of dust pops off the CATCHER'S mitt as the slams inside.

Strike three! The BATTER lowers his head, helpless in the face of Migue overpowering fastball. FROM THE DUGOUT, Miguel's TEAMMATES CHEER him on. HEAD CO REYES (dark-skinned, 30s) nods approvingly, CLAPS. BEHIND THE HOMEPLATE BACKSTOP, a dozen rookie players als Kansas City uniforms cheer for their team. Two YOUNG PLAY clocking Miguel's pitches look at each others' radar guns read 92 and 93 MPH. As the next batter steps up to the plate, Miguel's catche (18), taps his index finger on his thigh, calling for an fastball. The next pitch is popped up on the infield between first home. Miguel locates the ball, points to the sky, but Jos first baseman, PEDRO BERROA, nearly collide, as the ball between them and the runners reach base safely. B1   FROM THE OBSERVATION TOWER, the ACADEMY'S DIRECTOR, ALVAREZ (light-skinned, late 50s) and several other COACH SCOUTS jot down notes on their clipboards. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   2.

C1   ON THE FIELD, Miguel glares at Pedro, who averts his kicks the dirt. Miguel looks in for the sign from Jose, nods, and deliver tight fastball that sends the batter stumbling backwards dirt. Some players LAUGH and heckle the batter. Others point an fingers at Miguel, who greets the batter back to the plat a friendly, but authoritative, grin. He sends in the next pitch and the batter swings right th it, getting nothing but air.

The TEAM (about 35 young men) gather around several table their standard baked chicken and rice lunch. The mood is friendly and playful as players tease each other across t tables. Miguel, sitting with his friends MARCOS (2nd base ALFONSO (3rd Base), works on a second helping of dessert.
Check out Sugar... Puts on twenty pounds in two months; now he's going for twenty more.
(mouth full of food)

All muscle, baby. Rock solid. For some NEW PLAYERS, distinguishable in the sea of BLUE uniforms by their BLACK "tryout" jerseys and ragged sneak is their first healthy meal, and they eat as if it were t last.   One of them, SALVADOR (Black, scrawny, 17) holds plate up to his mouth, shovelling food down his throat.
Slow down, kid, it ain't going nowhere. A few of the guys LAUGH.
(to Pedro)
If you hustled half as much as him, maybe you'd be hungry too. The other guys "ohhhh" Miguel's insult, as Salvador and M exchange subtle grins. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     3.

Kids crowd around in a circle, repeating after the animat English instructor, SENOR SANCHEZ, who goes over some Eng BASEBALL TERMS in the center. As he repeats the terms, he enthusiastically pantomimes the meanings of each.
Fly ball.
Fly ball.
Line drive.
Line drive.
Ground ball.
Ground ball.
Home run!
Hone rone! CLOSE ON Miguel, repeating the strange words.

It's dark, and most of the team sits around an old TV set watching the climactic final scene of Field of Dreams dub Spanish. Kevin Costner asks his father to play catch in a that sounds nothing like Kevin Costner. Miguel passes through the room, and we follow him out of room down a hall, and into...

...where he sits down at the bench press, lowers his head thought. TRACK IN CLOSE as he crosses himself, mouths a p then leans back onto the bench. TRACK OUT as he lifts the bar, and begins a set of presse
Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      4.

The Kansas City Director of Minor League Operations, RUDY HUBBARD (white, 40s), watches a TRYOUT SESSION, where TWO TEENS in worn street clothes pitch to uniformed catchers. AGENT talks on a cell phone nearby. Alvarez, the academy director, approaches one of the kids whispers in his ear. The kid smiles tentatively. Alvarez joins Rudy and they speak in English.
What'd you tell him?
I told him to grip the ball more gently. Like a tit. They both crack up. FROM THE TRYOUT MOUND. The kid looks over to the two men wowing about him. He breathes in, nervous...
Pedro, sweating hard, takes a few cuts, but only seems to hitting weak ground balls and foul tips.
Pedro Berroa. Third year.     Hasn't developed like we hoped.
How much he sign for?
Forty-five.
Jesus. These kids keep getting more expensive. How much did you sign for back in the day?
3000.   When I was fifteen. Rudy smiles and moves on.    Alvarez follows.   Pedro wat men as they walk away.
Alvarez and Rudy approach a PITCHING COACH instructing Sa Miguel warms up next to him. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     5. ALVAREZ
Salvador Torres. Been practicing with the team for almost a week. Still raw, but he's got a lot of potential. RUDY
We gonna sign him? ALVAREZ
Soon. Soon. We want to play it low- key, see what his agent says. RUDY
How much you think? ALVAREZ
They've gotten two offers from other clubs. Agent says they were around a hundred. Rudy raises his eyebrows. ALVAREZ
(firm) He's good. Rudy looks over to Miguel. RUDY
What about him? ALVAREZ
Miguel Santos. Great arm. We signed him two years ago for fifteen. Miguel fires in a pitch.    Rudy nods, impressed. RUDY
Good deal.    He throw any junk? ALVAREZ
(in Spanish) Sugar! Miguel looks over, sees the American with Alvarez. ALVAREZ
Show us your curve. Miguel nods, nervous, focuses. He pitches.    The ball cu very subtly over the plate for a strike. RUDY
Not bad.   Mind if I try something? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    6. Miguel looks back to the men. RUDY
Hey, kid, do you mind?   May I? Miguel stares blankly at Rudy, not understanding. ALVAREZ
(in Spanish) Give him the ball. Miguel hands Rudy the ball, and Rudy demonstrates how to a knuckle curve ball, which looks strangely unorthodox, w index finger tucked against the baseball. RUDY

Spike curve. Gives you more rotation, more movement. (hands Miguel the ball) You try. Miguel struggles to emulate Rudy's grip, so Rudy maneuver fingers into the correct position. Alvarez laughs. ALVAREZ
Vamos!   Let's go! Pitch it! Miguel looks over to his catcher, Jose. Winds up the next pitch, and soars it 5 feet wide of the mark. Rudy and Alvarez laugh.   Miguel looks back over his shou RUDY

It's okay, son, these things take time. You'll figure it out. Rudy pats Miguel on the back and walks off with Alvarez. stares at them hard as they go. He turns back to his catc determined, squeezes the ball in spike curve formation. Delivers. Misses badly again. JUMP CUTS take us through a half-doze bad curve attempts, as other players take notice and gath around, some laughing, until... ...finally a perfect curve twists dramatically through th landing centered in Jose's mitt. The other players erupt in amazement, while Miguel stares straight ahead. After a beat, he smiles wide. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     7.
Sr. Sanchez stands in front of a chalkboard, reading off of a scripted ENGLISH DIALOGUE for the class to repeat. T class' version of the words are jumbled and incomprehensi
I want to talk to you.
I want talk to you.
Your performance in the mound is not as good as last year. What is the problem?
Your performance in the mound is not good as last year. What is problem?
I don't know. Maybe my mechanic.
I don't know. Maybe mechanic.
I want to give you a chance.   It is up to you... CLOSE ON Miguel focused on the baseball in his hand. He practices his knuckle curve grip, not participating in th lesson.
I want to give you a chance.   Is up to you...

Miguel walks down a dirt road with his duffel bag. He exi past the gate, waving goodbye to the SECURITY GUARD. A10   Beyond the manicured lawns and landscaped gardens o Academy, Miguel passes through the overgrown, undeveloped where neighborhood CHILDREN play among grazing goats. He continues down the dirt road towards a paved highway in t distance, as bachata music fuels the sound track, and car over the following... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     8.

Thick stalks of sugarcane race through the frame. CLOSE O Miguel staring out the bus window. On his way home, he passes... A11   --half-clothed children flying a homemade kite. B11   --a truck of bananas barrelling by with a boy perch C11   --an old man sitting by the street, looking straigh D11   --flaming sugarcane alongside the road. E11   --three children wedged between their parents on a F11   --the tall, wheezing smokestack of the Cristobal Co refinery.

Miguel hops off the bus with his duffel, climbs the pedes walkway passing over dozens of rusty railroad cars used f transporting sugarcane to the refinery. We PAN Miguel acr the bridge, revealing burning smokestacks in the distance

Modest homes line the neighborhood, fashioned from corrug tin, painted in bold colors, no two houses alike. A skinn roams a barren lot. A group of WOMEN with their hair in c sit on crates around a dominoes table. They wave their he to Miguel, who smiles back. Local KIDS play stickball in a trash-strewn clearing with makeshift mitts fashioned from old milk cartons or cardbo They see Miguel and rush toward him as he paces up the bl SHOUTING his name. As Miguel approaches home, he makes eye contact with a gi ERICA (15), buying water from a delivery truck. She smile With the kids still clamoring around Miguel, he stops, un his duffel and hands out some used baseballs. The kids gr balls, then run off to play. Miguel approaches Erica.   She puts down her water bucket Miguel a hug.
How are you, sis?
Any news about the States? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   9.

Is that all you have to say? Miguel helps Erica with the water bucket and walks with h towards their home - a small wooden construction with pee paint and a rusted aluminum roof. On the lot next to thei house, the cinder-block frame of their future home dwarfs others on the block.

Miguel and Erica enter the house, where their brother LUI watches an enormous television, which feels incongruous i middle of the tiny, dilapidated home. The reception is st crappy, though. Miguel's grandmother, ABUELA, sits upright on her mattres the corner of the room.
Hello, Abuela. You're looking beautiful. She smiles big at her oldest grandson, opens her arms for Erica sits at the kitchen table, where her schoolbooks la
What's up my people?   How's the TV?
Erica won't let me watch baseball.
Not during American Idol, anyway. Miguel's mother, CARMEN (late 30s) emerges from behind a bed sheet, which acts as a "wall" separating two rooms.
Buenas, Miguelito! Do you have any good news for your mother?
As a matter of fact, yes.
You're going to the United States?!
Not yet, ma... But I learned how to throw a knuckle curve.
A knuckle curve? What's that? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     10.
A GROUP of KIDS gather at the window.
Sugar, come out and play!

Gathered under the only functioning street lamp, Miguel r back and throws in a swooping curve, that causes the BATT flinch out of the way, as it breaks perfectly over the pl Carmen, Luis and the rest of the barrio ONLOOKERS, "ooooh impressive curve. Miguel notices a group of GIRLS eyeing him from across th street. His eyes stop on one, SOFIA (17). They exchange g

Miguel's family - minus Miguel - watches a soap opera. and Erica are in dialogue with the TV. The CAMERA PANS away from the family, out the back window the new home is being constructed. We ZOOM IN on the stru covered in plastic tarp.
Amidst tools, dry cement, a half-finished wooden dining t and other assorted construction materials, Miguel has sex Sofia on a work table.
Miguel throws on his t-shirt. Sofia looks at the wooden d table. It's artfully done, with details etched into the l
When will you finish this?
Soon.   It's just hard to find the time.
It's pretty.
I'm trying to match the chairs my dad made, but I can't get it right.
Well, I think it's perfect. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   11. MIGUEL
I'll make you another when I'm done. Sofia smiles, kisses Miguel on the cheek. SOFIA
And the rest of the house?   How long till it's done? Miguel hesitates. MIGUEL
Um, another month, maybe two... You know we just did it where Abuela's room is going to be... SOFIA
(laughing) Don't tell me that! MIGUEL
Why not? We can do it in mom's kitchen next. Right over there. SOFIA
(getting serious) I hope you make it to the States this year. MIGUEL
You hope? C'mon, there's nobody better, baby. SOFIA
(smiling big) Okay, how about: I KNOW you'll make it. MIGUEL
Now you're talkin'. And when I do, I'll buy a Cadillac, drive it through the ocean, and bring you back with me. SOFIA
You can't drive a Cadillac on water. MIGUEL
Yes! In the States they make cars that drive on water. SOFIA
You're crazy. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   12.
You'll see who's crazy.   Just watch.
I want to see the snow.   Does it snow in Kansas City?
I don't know. But I'll take you to New York City. Yankee Stadium. It snows there. You wanta see me play in Yankee Stadium?
It doesn't snow during baseball season, silly.
So we'll go for Christmas.
Promise?
Next Christmas, we'll sail into Yankee Stadium in my Cadillac car-boat. Deal?
You are crazy! They kiss.

Miguel, Sofia, JAVIER (Black, 22) JAMIE (Black, 26) and ALEXANDRA (one of Sofia's friends) hang out by the maleco (waterside), drinking rum and dancing to merengue that bl out the open doors of a nearby car. The mood is festive.
(mid-story)
I liked her, but she asked me to cut my hair. I thought about it. She was cute, but... I liked my hair more.
I liked it too, Javi.
Then why'd you cut it last week?
I thought it was time for a new look. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      13.
Or a new girl. Sofia punches Miguel in the arm.
Watch it, baby, that's a million-dollar arm you're messing with.
He's right!    All hail the golden arm. Javier and the girls drunkenly salute Miguel's arm, prete dust dirt away, but Jaime doesn't play along. He looks on little jealous.
You call that flabby rubberband an arm?
Oooh...
This flabby rubberband can throw 95. What can yours do?
I threw 98 in double-A Portland.

98? Then why you washing windshields now? I saw you try and bumrush Javy at the stoplight last week. Everyone cracks up laughing, including Jaime, as Miguel g Sofia, and leads her in a dance. His smile fading, Jaime looks out over the water.   Migue notices this. Hold.

20 Various Sunday morning images establishing Miguel's homet --A dewey mist covers an empty baseball field, surrounded acres of tall sugarcane. --Women hang laundry on the line to dry. --A rooster walks alone through a graveyard. --People spill out of church into the road. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   14.
--MIDDLE-AGED MEN drink beer in the dugout during a softb game.

A makeshift diamond is overrun with weeds, ditches, stone trash for bases. Donkeys graze in the outfield, unphased LITTLE KIDS (10-14 years old) playing around them. A YOUNG PITCHER fires in a fastball that BEANS the YOUNG in the back. IN THE BLEACHERS, TWO MIDDLE-AGED MEN drink beer and occasionally heckle the kids.

You're supposed to aim for the head! Nearby, Miguel sits beside his old coach, FRANK (early 40 watching the kids play. One of the local SHOE SHINE BOYS Miguel's shoes with an old toothbrush as Frank cracks ope beer. Frank points out one of the kids on the field.
I like this one. Good bat speed. Only twelve years old, out here four, five hours everyday. His mom tells me he's missing school. I say, yeah, but... have you seen his swing? They laugh.
I'm showing his older brother to the Yankees on Monday. Miguel nods, a hint of disappointment in his eyes.
(seeing this)

They don't know what they missed with you. It's cool though. They'll be knocking on your door, offering millions when you turn into a superstar. You'll see... Miguel nods, appreciating the vote of confidence.
Have you been to New York? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   15. FRANK
(nodding) Nothing like playing for a crowd of New Yorkers. They're even louder than Dominicans. MIGUEL
What's the city like? FRANK
It's great. But you need to get to Kansas City before you start thinking about New York. Know what I mean? MIGUEL
You hear anything about spring training yet? FRANK
Yep. Frank sips his beer. MIGUEL
And? Frank shrugs, as Miguel's sister calls out from the stree ERICA
Miguel, Luis! Dinner is ready! MIGUEL
You'd tell me if you knew. FRANK
Maybe. Miguel shakes his head, gets up. MIGUEL
Wanna join us for dinner? FRANK

Not tonight. But give your mom a kiss for me, okay? Miguel gives a coin to the boy who's been cleaning his sh before heading off with his little brother. Frank sips his beer, calls out to the field-- FRANK
C'mon, Nelson! Fire it in, baby! Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07       16.
A mist hovers over the empty field.
A group of Academy EMPLOYEES shuffle down the dirt road o

Miguel, laying awake in the upper bed, hears his bunk-mat Alfonso, stirring beneath him. Miguel peers over, sees Al discreetly pop several pills from a plastic baggy. They m brief eye contact before Alfonso heads out of the room.
Several middle-aged women sit on buckets near an open doo peeling yucca. A man fries eggs at the grill, preparing breakfast for the players.
The players eat breakfast.     The mood is strangely quie
The signed players sit around in uniform, while the unsig "trial" players wear their black jerseys. Coach Reyes add them in mid-speech.

A lot of you are thinking about your families right now. Your girlfriends, sisters and brothers, grandparents. You're feeling the pressure. But, I'm going to tell you something very important, gentlemen... forget it. You've got to think about yourselves. Put all your energy into your game, into your development as a player. Forget about everything else in your life... and just play ball. You wanna succeed, you gotta be like a racehorse, focused on your goal. It's up to you.

Several players work out on bars attached to the side of building. As Miguel lowers himself after a set of pull-ups, he noti shiny, black, luxury SUV drive into the academy parking l Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     17.
Miguel watches as Alvarez gets out of the driver's seat, business on his cell phone.

Miguel exercises his pitching arm by stretching an elasti tied against a chain-link fence. As he stretches, he watc group of players line up for a sprint drill, sizing up hi future competition. Salvador, wearing his black jersey, races for his life, b all the others.

The sweat-drenched players line up according to their pos waiting their turns to participate in a double-play drill the pitchers cover first base. Miguel awaits his turn, watching another pitcher, EDDY, r first to receive a throw from second base, but before Edd catch the ball... ...he twists his ankle tripping over the bag. The coaches rush over to Eddy, who is on the ground winci pain. Miguel and the rest of the team watch in nervous anticipation as Eddy struggles to his feet, limps off the with the aid of another player.

Next up, Miguel! Here we go! The ball is hit on the ground to first base, where the fi quickly throws it over to second. Miguel charges over to stutter steps as he nears the base, and receives the thro in time to beat the hitter and step out of the way. He ex in relief.
The players shower after a gruelling day of workouts.
Miguel lounges with an elaborate ice-wrap around his shou and upper arm as other players get dressed into street cl Coach Reyes comes in, spots Pedro.
Berroa, see Alvarez when you're dressed. Pedro nods.   Miguel and Marcos exchange knowing glances. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     18.
The team eats dinner.    At Miguel's table, we catch the of a joke...

So the Dominican's like, `Fuck, what am I gonna do?' He stays there, points up to the sky and says. `Look! There's a plane... Right THERE!' Everyone laughs hysterically, as... ...the young rookie, Salvador, grabs a seat next to Migue adjoining table.
Hey, Sugar!    They made me an offer. Miguel smiles, but hesitates for a beat as Pedro walks pa and over to an empty table in the corner of the room. Mig turns back to Salvador, pats him on the head.
Good for you. Congratulations.     How much they offer you?
(with a big smile)
(sensing the other players surprise)
But, you know, my manager's taking, like, forty of it... What'd you sign for?
Oh, you know, more or less the same. Did you get any other offers?
Yankees and Seattle, but not as much.
Just don't get cocky. No one likes a dickhead... Welcome to the team. Salvador smiles.
So, why do they call you Sugar? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      19.
Well it's like this... it started cause I'm sweet with the ladies. But mostly it's cause I got the sweetest knuckle curve in the whole Republic.
(interjecting)
Bullshit! You just learned that shit on Friday! It's cause he eats so much junk food! Salvador notices two pieces of cake on Miguel's tray.
(playing it cool)
He's just jealous. Miguel notices Pedro across the room, staring at his food
A dozen players sit around the television, watching a shl American horror film on DVD.
Pedro packs his belongings into a KC Knights' duffel bag, Miguel, Marcos, and Alfonso approach his bunk.
We got you a going away present. Miguel unzips his windbreaker to reveal a bottle of Bruga hidden underneath. The other guys smile mischievously.
Miguel, Marcos, Alfonso, and Pedro tip-toe across the gra whispering at each other to shut up.
The four players toast their rum in little plastic cups. bottle is nearly finished.
You should try Los Campos. I heard the Dodgers could use a new first baseman.
Fuck that. The coaches are even tougher over there. I'm done, man.
Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07     20. PEDRO (cont'd)

No more curfews, nobody tellin' me what to do and how to do it. For real, I'm glad this shit's over. I'm a free man. Awkward silence. The players look at Pedro with pity, uns how to respond. After a beat, Miguel mocks coach Reyes an others follow suit, mocking Alvarez and the other coaches
(snatching Pedro's cap)
No caps indoors, son!
Cut the meat with your knife; eat the meat with your fork. NEVER eat the meat with your knife.
Or you'll chop off your tongue.
Ten p.m. lights out!
(in broken English)
"Tay me outta the ball game, tay me outta the crowd..." The other players laugh, join Pedro in a loud whisper...

"...buys me so peanut and crackay- yacks. I doe-care if I never get back. Roo, roo, roo for home teams, we doe- win is a shame..." Pedro breaks off from the song, looks out over the field, verge of crying. One by one, the other players take notic stop singing. Silence. Hold.
Hungover, Miguel vomits in the toilet.    Reyes opens the
Santos, what the hell's wrong with you?

I think I have the flu, coach.    I can't pitch today. Reyes glances over to Marcos and Alfonso standing nearby. lower their heads in embarrassment like two kids busted b Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      21.
You've got five minutes to get out on that mound, Santos. Reyes marches off.

Miguel on the mound. Takes a deep breath. He utilizes eve ounce of strength to deliver a pitch, and... CRACK! The visiting Detroit Academy HITTER knocks the bal the left field wall for a homerun, wherein... BLAH! Miguel throws up on the mound.   All the players ga disgust, but Reyes just laughs. Miguel looks over to Alvarez, sitting under an umbrella w clipboard, then to Reyes, hoping he'll yank him out of th but Reyes just claps.

Feel better now? Let's go! Miguel tries to shake off the cobwebs, steps on the rubbe stares down the next hitter. CLOSE on his hand revealing the knuckle curve grip. He to in the next pitch, which arcs into Jose's glove for a...

Strike! Reyes' smile fades, stunned by the beautiful curve. A SERIES OF JUMPCUTS take us through the next three batte Miguel makes quick work of them, mixing up his nasty curv a blazing fastball. After the third out, Miguel walks back to the dugout. a seat on the bench, smiles smugly.
Wipe that smile off your face. And he does.
Miguel, Alfonso, and Marcos run laps around the field as punishment for the previous night's activities. They look they could pass out at any moment.
Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07    22.

Miguel and Marcos sit on a couch in a bare-walled waiting outside Alvarez's office. They sit quietly, like two kids waiting for the principal. Coach Reyes pokes his head out of Alvarez's office, motio inside.
Miguel and Marcos stare straight ahead, nervously.   Alva stares at them, icy cold. After a beat...
I am very disappointed. Just when I was starting to like you guys, you go and do something stupid. What do you have to say for yourselves?
But Alfonso was there too--
--No excuses. This is unacceptable behavior. You guys need to learn discipline. Miguel and Marcos lower their heads.

You need to remember that you still have a long way to go, a lot of hard work ahead of you before you make it. First, there's getting your shot in the American Minor Leagues: rookie ball, single, double, triple A - all that before you even set foot in a major league ballpark. So, you better pull it together quick...
Because nobody's gonna take this shit from a couple Dominican rookies when you go to the U.S. for Spring Training this season. They glance up, eyes wide.   Did he just say...
You've been invited to Spring Training. Everyone smiles (even Alvarez). Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   23.

CAMERA follows behind the FLOOR MANAGER, as he passes row WOMEN of all ages, working on sewing machines for an Amer underwear company. He stops behind one woman, taps her on shoulder. The woman removes her earphones, turns around. Miguel's mother, Carmen.
Phone call.    He said it's important.
Carmen picks up the phone.
Hello? Hold on her reaction shifting from that of concern to ela She struggles to contain her joy.

Miguel opens a new bottle of rum, pours shots for everyon whole family and all of Miguel's neighbors are jammed ins tiny house and spilling out into the street. Merengue bla from the new home stereo system. FRIENDS and FAMILY pat Miguel on the back. He smiles, bas in the glory of success. Erica kisses Miguel on the cheek
Don't forget to call everyday.    I want to know everything!
Everything?
You know what I mean, dummy.
Of course I'll be calling to keep you in check, make sure your grades don't slip.

Look who's talking. Carmen interrupts, drapes her arms around Miguel, kissing repeatedly. As Erica looks on, we get the sense that she' to being on the outside of this kind of attention. Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07      24. CARMEN
You are my hero! Carmen pulls Miguel close, takes something from her pocke it in his hand. CARMEN
It was your father's.     I want you to take it with you... Miguel looks at the cross, kisses his mother on the cheek he looks up, he notices Erica slip away. CARMEN

You've been   given a wonderful gift, Miguelito.    And God willing, you will continue to   do great things with it. I love you so   much. She kisses him on the forehead. A SERIES OF JUMPCUTS present a variety of family and frie introducing themselves to Miguel. UNCLE ANGEL
Miguelito! You gonna remember your uncle Angel when you're all big and famous? Don't forget your family, kid. Never forget where you came from.
COUSIN LUPE
Lupe! Cousin Lupe! Remember that time we went skinny-dipping at the Malecon? MIGUEL
When?
COUSING FELIPE
You were eight years old! Hated the goats so much. You would cry and cry and cry and cry. What a baby you were. Do you remember?
MIGUEL
What's your name? Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07        25. AUNT LOLA
Lola!   Your aunt Lola!
UNCLE JEFFE
Uncle Jeffe!
NEIGHBOR ANA
Your neighbor Ana. I grew up around the corner from here. Ana lays a juicy kiss on Miguel.   He smiles.
FRANK
Don't give me any shit, kid.      I taught you everything you know. Miguel gives Frank a big hug. FRANK
I'm damn proud of you, kid.    Your father would be, too. MIGUEL
Thanks.    I owe it all to you. FRANK
Not all.   Just forty percent. Miguel smiles, as Frank leans close. FRANK
I spent the best years of my life playing in the States. Life gives you a lot of opportunities, but baseball only gives you one. Enjoy every minute of it. Miguel nods. FRANK
How's your new curve? MIGUEL
It's pretty sweet. FRANK
Good.   Here... Official Shooting Script as of 10/22/07   26.
Frank hands Miguel a pen.
What's this for?
Your autograph. Miguel seems puzzled, but searches for something to write
I'm kidding, you arrogant prick. It's so you can write your family... and me, too... if you feel like it. Miguel gives Frank another hug.
Miguel dances salsa with Sofia, and then switches partner dances with Carmen. As he dances close with his mother, he catches a glimpse Erica standing with some friends off to the side.
Miguel and Erica stand in silhouette, isolated from the p raging outside. Miguel sands one of the legs of the dinin table.
Where's your boyfriend?
Which one?
I don't know; the ugly one.
Hector?
Okay, where's Hector?
(shrugs, then)
